Instruction: Heat olive oil in a large paella pan or skillet over medium-high heat.
Chop onion, garlic, and bell peppers. Cut zucchini and yellow squash into bite-sized pieces.
Sauté onion and garlic until softened, then add bell peppers, zucchini, and yellow squash. Cook until tender-crisp.
Add rice to the pan and toast for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Stir in saffron, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Slowly pour in vegetable broth, ensuring the rice is submerged.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir in peas and lima beans. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with pimentón and garnish with lemon wedges before serving.
